intro: Eleutherococcus baoxinensis, commonly known as the Baoxinensis Siberian ginseng, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its deciduous, compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. It thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
